title: When It Comes to Russia, Trump Navigates Conflicting Goals
summary: President Trump’s efforts to court President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia are rife with contradictions about stability and displays of American power.

title: During Maduro Raid in Venezuela, a Close Call for Helicopters and Trump’s Plan
summary: As a damaged U.S. helicopter struggled to stay aloft over Venezuela’s capital, the success of the entire operation hung in the balance.

title: Hoisting Russian Flags, ‘Shadow Fleet’ Edges Into the Light
summary: The Marinera, which was seized by the U.S., isn’t the only ship from the “shadow fleet” of oil tankers to switch lately to a Russian identity, seeking protection.

title: Lawmakers Split After Classified Briefings on Venezuela
summary: Republicans praised what they characterized as a narrow and well-executed plan, while Democrats expressed alarm, warning that the mission was vaguely defined.

title: Renee Good, Victim in Minneapolis ICE Shooting, Remembered for Her Kindness
summary: Renee Good, 37, a resident of Minneapolis, was mourned on Wednesday as a cherished member of the community.

title: The ICE Shooting Came During an Operation Focused on Somali Immigrants
summary: Federal immigration officials have stepped up enforcement activity in Minnesota amid a fraud scandal there that includes many people of Somali origin.

title: Horns, Whistles and Then Gunfire on a Minneapolis Street
summary: A man opened his door to discover a tableau of deadly violence after a federal agent fatally shot a woman.

title: Trump Says He Wants Congress to Stop Wall St. From Buying Single-Family Houses
summary: The president said he wanted Congress to stop the purchases by big investors, which have driven up rents and set obstacles for first-time buyers in some markets.

title: Trump Pulls Out of Global Climate Treaty
summary: The action could make it more difficult for a future administration to rejoin the Paris climate accord, the agreement among most nations to fight climate change.

title: Trump Withdraws the U.S. From More International Organizations
summary: The executive order the president signed Wednesday follows a broader vision of American foreign policy that shuns coalition building and the consensus of nations.

title: Justice Dept. Staff Fear Turmoil Diverts Them From Potential Threats
summary: Rank-and-file prosecutors and agents have expressed serious concern that a hobbled work force hurts the government’s ability to identify and stop terrorist plots, cyberattacks, mass violence and fraud.

title: New Novels to Read This Year
summary: Tayari Jones, Ann Patchett, George Saunders and Veronica Roth return with new novels; Jennette McCurdy makes her fiction debut; and more.

title: New Nonfiction Books to Read This Year
summary: Memoirs by Sylvester Stallone and the founder of Barstool Sports; essays from celebrated novelists Jesmyn Ward and Jayne Anne Phillips; and more.

title: Steny Hoyer, Longest-Serving House Democrat, to Retire From Congress
summary: The Maryland congressman, who served as one of his party’s top leaders, plans to depart after nearly half a century in Congress, as his party looks toward generational change.

title: Why Russian Tourists Are Flocking to Southern China’s Beaches
summary: Russians find a refuge on the beaches of Sanya from sanctions and “sideways looks,” toasting the New Year beside a Chinese nuclear submarine base.

title: Nick Reiner’s Lawyer, Alan Jackson, Removes Himself From Murder Case
summary: Mr. Reiner, who is charged with killing his parents, will now be represented by a public defender. His arraignment has been rescheduled for next month.

title: As Charlie Kirk’s Turning Point Pushes Into High Schools, Dissension Follows
summary: Since Mr. Kirk’s death, chapters of his organization’s affiliate for teenagers have more than doubled in number, aided by politicians who have said they won’t tolerate opposition.

title: University to Pay $500,000 to Professor It Fired Over Charlie Kirk Post
summary: Austin Peay State University in Tennessee also reinstated Darren Michael, a tenured acting professor whose post about Mr. Kirk’s killing inflamed conservatives.

title: Texas A&M Warns Professor Not to Teach Plato Because of Gender Rules
summary: The university is reviewing courses under new rules restricting teaching about race and gender. Administrators told a philosophy professor to cut some lessons on Plato to comply.

title: Protests Spread in Iran, and Crackdowns Escalate
summary: Bazaars were shuttered and demonstrators met with violence from security forces amid rising anger about the country’s dire economic situation.

title: Can Timothée Chalamet Break This Oscar Curse?
summary: The best actor Oscar almost never goes to young men, though the 30-year-old has his best chance yet with “Marty Supreme.”

title: 2026 SAG Actor Award Nominations List: ‘One Battle’ and ‘Sinners’ Lead
summary: Timothée Chalamet and Ariana Grande also scored nods. Cynthia Erivo and the stars of “Jay Kelly” were left out.

title: How Machado Lost Her Chance to Lead Venezuela
summary: The opposition leader’s uncompromising style explains her political rise. But will that brand of politics work as well when it comes to running a country?

title: Trump Is About to Lose Control of the Economy
summary: Will anyone be in charge?

title: Spencer Pratt, Reality TV Star, Runs for Mayor of Los Angeles
summary: The star of “The Hills,” whose house burned in the Palisades fire, has used his social media profile to hammer Mayor Karen Bass and other California Democrats over the past year.

title: Philip Yancey, Prominent Christian Author, Admits to Extramarital Affair
summary: He said he would retire from writing and public speaking.

title: Glenn Hall, Pathbreaking All-Star Hockey Goalie, Dies at 94
summary: Known as “Mr. Goalie,” he created the so-called butterfly style and played in a record 502 consecutive games, without wearing a mask. He received 300 stitches.
